title: Excellent service
body: The doctor phoned me at 8.15pm today, she didn’t have to but she did this because she cares about her patients. I struggle with anxieties and she is always understanding. I know some people are complaining that doctors are only doing phone calls but I actually prefer them unless I need to physically see them and this practice still offers appointments too. This surgery deserves a lot of praise for the fantastic work that they do!

title: Appalling GP Practice
body:
Appalling Service from doctors… I am absolutely shocked at the care provided and how they treat their patients. 

Always being passed over to different doctors, who get confused with your health conditions despite the fact everything is written on your records. 

Reading through a patients record before contacting them does no harm. It is basic knowledge to know a bit about the patient in order to help treat them, this makes the patient feel at ease to know your doctor is aware about your medical history. 

Understandably due to covid everything is a telephone consultation, however some rules can be put in place for a patient to be seen by a GP if absolutely necessary. 

The Phone lines and appointment system is also terrible, Seems to me nothing is properly organised. 

How on earth do they expect over 1000 patients to be calling at 8.00am be held in a queue to get an appointment by 8.30am. 

When you finally get through the appointments are all gone for that whole day. 

They don’t even have a afternoon timing to call which makes no sense, there are working people who cannot call at 8.00am and as everything is a telephone appt you can’t book online either, slots are blocked! It like a never ending nightmare! 

Clearly there is a lot of faults with this practice and a lot needs to change in order for things to run smoothly and for a patients care to be prioritised.

title: Impossible to Contact.!!!
body:
Dreadful dreadful dreadful, impossible to contact by phone, was no.19 in the queue, updated as my position rise to number 3 and then a continual loop of music, have been waiting one hour and twenty minutes to be answered... Have given up...
This really is completely unacceptable.. please sort your Practice out...!
You mention in other review replies about a new phone system...really..?
You also mention about getting more staff.... Really..? 
This really is the worst Surgery I have ever dealt with and believe me, I deal with a few... !

title: Excellent service
body: Thursday 2nd Sept I was taken to the hospital by wonderful ambulance staff. The staff at the hospital were warm, wonderful, friendly and thorough. Cant praise them or thank them enough❤

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: medicine review
body: The review started in June as a result many blood pressure s were taken in practice and home to no conclusion finally after the last one this month September and giving the result to the reception I phoned after a few days to ask what to do I was told someone would phone twice but no on my third call the result couldn't be found initially but eventually was still in the tray not looked at. I have been at this practice for over 30 years but now it has deteriated beyond belief

title: Good service
body: Health Harmo ie Landmark Reading. Opthalmology appointment, efficient and friendly staff. Clear advice given.

title: Abysmal Service
body:
To start I have worked for the NHS for 10 years and never once complained or had to chase an appointment and I understand completely the stress and strain the NHS is under especially during the pandemic,but today I have felt really let down by the service I received.

I am 39 weeks pregnant and was visiting the ante natal scan unit for a growth scan as they were concerned baby weighed too much. I arrived at 12:45pm for a 1pm appointment and was seen pretty much straight away. After the scan the sonographer informed me I had to have a review by the doctor and to register at the ANDU desk for this. I handed in my notes and was asked to be seated. Fast forward to 3pm, a very busy waiting room full of expectant mothers all waiting to see a GP and not one of us had been called. At this point I was getting a little frustrated and anxious so I enquired in regards to my appointment and the wait. I was told I was 3rd in the pile and the doctor was on dinner. I had to await a further hour until eventually I was called in, only to be told I didn't really need to wait as I already have an induction booked and just to plan and come back for that.

Feel really let down that it has taken near 3 hours for a doctor to review my notes, only to tell me I need to await my induction and to go home. On top of all that she wasn't even sure why I was booked an induction in the first place. When I explained she told me that I mught as well have it anyway as I'm 39 weeks. I complained in regards to the wait time as without my husband (who had to wait in the car) I had got worked up and anxious, and the doctor just told me they are short staffed Friday and that was that.

Lots of women in the same position as me and some waited longer. I think the whole system needs to be reviewed and reconsidered, especially during COVID. Not happy with the service one bit.

title: Impossible to make an appointment
body: There are no appointment bookings on the website. I have explained my symptoms in writing there and been advised to contact the surgery to make an appointment. I have attempted 11 times over the last 4 weeks and have been number 13 up to number 23 in the queue. It is unreasonable to wait that long, always with the possibility of being cut off while waiting. What to do?

title: Rude receptionist
body:
Hello,
I am so unhappy and very stressed by the situation I am in.
On 3/9/21 in the afternoon, have called the practice and waited for over 1 hour for someone to answer, no luck, so went to the practice to find out any updates with regard to my urgent referral. Explained to the receptionist that I was waiting for over 1 hour for the practice to answer my call, as I only wanted to let them know that the hospital didn't received my referral. The receptionist was rude, abrupt and answered :" well we are busy and the referral was sent and how to explain this to you so you can understand ". I have explained that I know very well how the system works as I was a cancer patient.
I strongly believe all the patients should be treated with respect  and carried for.
I do have a great admiration for all NHS staff and I know how hard they are working, but if they cannot be up to their job requirements then might need to look for a different job.
Regards

title: Excellent service
body: Phoned today as needed a medication review. Was told that the clinical pharmacist would contact me the same day. She phoned within 2hours and reauthorised my medication over the phone. No need to visit the surgery. Excellent service

title: Exceptional care and “service”
body:
Having suffered with knee pain for some years, the time came to get is resolved, as far as is possible.

From initial consultation to the surgery which I had today, I really and simply cannot fault the professionalism and dedication this hospital provides.

The day surgery unit who took care of me today were just fantastic, from arrival to discharge they made feel like I was their only patient.

Receptionists, nurses, porters (sorry I’ve forgotten their new title), theatre staff and the surgeons were, well fantastic.

Whilst my visit was a smooth one, I have been left in no doubt that had I experienced any medical issues or discomfort, the staff would have sprung into action and resolved the the issue promptly.

I really don’t know what’s to say, and if you met me you would know that’s unusual, but I’m in awe of the service and care I have received from this hospital, in particular the day surgery unit. 

Thank you for all you have done and continue to do under very difficult circumstances, despite the COVID pandemic!

title: Warm reception
body: We came to the minor injuries clinic. We had received good advice by telephone beforehand (they had answered very quickly) but the reception at the clinic was just as good. Very warm and friendly and helped to put us at our ease. We had to wait a while but reception explained the reason. Excellent service!

title: Great atmosphere
body:
Relative has been in treatment for months 
Truly dedicated staff group 
So thankful to all at Kneesworth House, it is however a very large site so plenty of activities to do

title: Best Hospital Experience
body: Went in for the decompression of the lumbar surgery on the last day of August. Came back home three days later with renewed energy from the love and care I got from the staffs on the Iris Ward where I stayed to recover. I'm so grateful for all their support and work during this pandemic. They are the real heroes.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Friendly and efficient
body: My elderly father has had to have a dressing renewed regularly on his arm and elbow over the last three weeks. The young nurse was friendly, efficient and made the visits for my Dad a good experience - she even laughed at his jokes! Thank you - I appreciated your happy attitude towards Dad and the nursing care was first class.

title: A & E visit
body:
I felt unwell during the night and was admitted to A& E for tests. I can’t fault the staff considering how busy they were. 

The tests were carried out in a reassuring manner and the staff concerned were kind and courteous. 

I had a further test the following morning and was given the medications necessary to stabilise a few hitherto unknown issues. 

I hope my remarks will be forwarded to the departments concerned - A & E, CT scanning and X Ray.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I ended up on the Mary Seacole ward following breaking my leg. I cannot praise the care and treatment I received enough, despite the obvious pressures the NHS is currently under. Every member of staff I encountered, on all levels were kind and considerate. Landing in hospital unexpectedly and not being able to have visitors is really quite scary and the staff helped me get through a very worrying time. I can never thank them enough.

title: Disrespectful
body: Waited in all day for a telephone rang three times said yes you will still get your telephone nothing happened useless

title: Outstanding Service & Care
body: Couldn't fault anything, all members of the practice really went above and beyond to help treat my 10 month old daughter. The time from her condition being reported to the diagnosis and medications prescribed was fantastic. Extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Amazing service, really truly appreciated. Thank you!

title: Great Practice
body: We have only been patients for a couple of months, but so far I have been very impressed with the high level of care my husband and I have experienced. Friendly reception staff, fantastic and kind nurse, caring doctors and a great practice manager.

title: Good Services
body:
I have just been discharged from having our little girl. I was induced and stayed on the labour ward for 3 days before moving to post natal for 1 day. 
Staff on labour ward were very attentive when you rung the bell. I felt the care given to my little one was great during the induction and was Consistent. Saw lots of different midwifes which I fortunately got very confusing as it wasn’t always clear who was looking after you on the shift. There was a clear lack of staffing in regards to MCA’s. Spent 3 days there and not once was mine or any of the bed sheets changed. Only twice was my water jug refilled. And was not offered any other drinks while there. Breakfast often wasn’t offered you had to ring and ask for it. Once transferred to the post natal ward the care I received was second to none. Fantastic attentive staff who really reassured me and supported me during my recovery. I would also like to add that the care I received from all the team during my c-section was above and beyond. I felt so well looked after and reassured. A terrifying situation made much better, in a calm controlled environment. Felt completely safe and able to enjoy the arrival of our little one. Thank you all on the maternity ward for your fantastic work

title: Helpful Staff
body: Needed a cover letter to be filled in, so my details on my vaccination pass matched my passport, so I can go aboard. Very helpful and nice staff and just want to say how much I appreciate it and Thank You for all you help. :)

title: Fantastic prompt service
body: After ringing up early morning fri 3rd Sept due to my husband having bad floaters. I spoke to the nicest receptionist over the telephone you could ever wish for. Her mannerism, understanding and helpfulness was second to none. She explained that my husbands details would be passed on  and if he needed to be seen she would ring me back.( she had already given us app for October). To be honest due to my husband having ongoing health issues this problem with his eyes was very worrying.  The receptionist reassured me. This very helpful lady is called Helen and I hope these comments are passed on. She rang myself back and we got appointment at 3pm, which was just superb. On attending we were myself and my husband who's vision was impaired  had first class service all equipment fully cleaned due to my husband having no immunity,  this was a worry but didn't need to worry, all aspects explained. The lady who did the eye test was fab even put us in a little room on our own due to my husband having no immunity. The ophthalmologist  was first class spotted what  was wrong straight away very reassuring and arranged follow up treatment. Thank you so much to the opthalmology department and all staff concerned excellent treatment especially in these covid times. We felt completely safe, reassured and understood. Keep up the excellent work

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Phone contact
body:
I refuse to phone this surgery because of the prerecorded ramble I am expected to endure.  I could only take about three minutes of it. It is unbelievably slow and basically advertising for the surgery.  People need to contact the surgery without using up their credit.
Apart from that I have no complaints.

title: This Dr is a Saint
body: Thank you so much Dr for helping me so much in the last few years ,this Dr was so caring and professional that the kind Dr went that extra mile to help you.Once again thank you so much and thank you Barts hospital keep up with the amazing work you do under this hard strenuous times you all our heroes in my eyes ,especially the Dr who was their for me

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Shocking service
body: Almost impossible to get through on the telephone. I've been trying for 3 days for up to an hour at a time. This is an impossible ask when people also have a job to do.

title: Really happy with service!
body: I have recently had to have to use the practice a number of times , when I have not had to much before. I have found that their response has been very efficient when using e-reception. I have been really impressed as a patient and my issues and referrals have been dealt with very quickly. I have nothing but positive praise for the team in what has been an extremely difficult 18 months for the NHS. Thank you

title: Excellent practice
body:
My wife and  I have been registered with the practice for many years.
 We have always had excellent service from the friendly professional staff and never any problems getting a consultation when needed.
We feel very privileged to be a part of such a well run surgery.

title: Terrible hospital.
body: I wouldn't recommend anyone go to this hospital at all. I went to A&E on Monday night after having a fall the triage nurses were absolutely lovely and really understanding but that's where it started and ended. I was eventually seen by a doctor who took me for an X-ray after my X-ray I was just dumped outside the doors of CDU and left there until the doctor came back to see me. I was then taken somewhere else where the same doctor put me in a room and told me that I could sit in either the bed or the chair bearing in mind I had just been told that I had a broken ankle and foot the doctor walked away and left me sat in the wheelchair with no breaks on it and I had to struggle to get myself out of the chair and on to the bed at one point the chair moved whilst I was trying to stand up. I then had 2 lovely nurses come in to see me but the nurse who took a blood sample from left the needle that she had used in the bed with me. I was then moved to another room and just left with no clue what was going on. The next day I was past from one place to another at one point I was put on a ward where my bag had been left wide open on a bed with my phone and everything on show it had been taken from where I was staying and just left on a bed. I had an incredibly rude consultant who decided to reposition my fractured ankle without any painkillers and then had the nerve to turn round and say to me you don't want surgery do you when I'm screaming in pain because he was squeezing and twisting my ankle he made me feel like an inconvenience-no bedside manner what so ever. I was then put on CDU where I had a nurse shout at me from across the room to find out what my name was and how you spell it I had to ask twice for painkillers and never got any. Physio came and watched me walk with crutches for 2 seconds and then just left when I was trying to get back to the bed I could've fallen but that didn't matter to them. I was then just thrown out of the hospital no one knew if I had someone picking me up I was just wheeled outside of A&E and left sat there in a wheelchair in the cold on my own at no point did any ask if there was someone coming for me I was just thrown outside like I didn't matter. I wouldn't let my worst enemy go to this hospital. You are not a patient you are just an inconvenience that they want to be rid of as soon as possible.

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: Brilliant service
body: Fantastic from the moment I walked in this morning until I left. Everyone was friendly and put my mind at ease as I was super nervous!

title: Worst doctors I've ever had
body: Seen 2 docs here since I joined in November this year. One doctor was very rude and abrupt !!! I have refused to see this one again.  Im still waiting for my call back from my last telephone call as the computers were all down .my health is now suffering big time and I need to see a doctor. ASAP. Its not a case I should go to hospital either a doctor can sort these issues out.  Im calling them Monday to get things sorted for once and for all.  My life matters and so does yours. Wake up springhead !!!

title: Really well organised, great staff.
body:
I visited A&E last night ( there is no option to choose A&E as a department I visited on the list of departments to leave a review for!?). It was 10 pm on a Friday night. I was prepared for a 4+ hour wait and a chaotic environment. 
It was a little disconcerting having to wait in a slow queue to get in the door, but when I did I realised why. They have a dr immediately on entering that assesses the issue in order to expedite appropriate treatment and ensure people get to the right place from the outset.
I was directed to a GP in the major injuries dept ( I think). I waited 10 mins max before being called through.
Really good young female Dr, listened to my problems and then called the relevant specialist ( maxilla facial dept) who arrived within minutes. Another really great young female Dr. They were both helpful, kind and I felt safe, reassured and listened to. The maxilla Dr was particularly helpful to me, she helped me understand why I was in so much pain and offered good advice and reassurance. Honestly I was really pathetically grateful for all the staff last night. They are doing a tough, dangerous tiring job and remain upbeat, compassionate and professional. 
I understand local community GPS are not able/ willing to see patients but really…are they at any more risk from covid than all the staff last night? I do suspect A&E are a lot busier than they need to be, driven by the fact pretty much no one can see a GP locally.
Please pass on my extreme gratitude to your outstanding staff, it does make a real difference to visitors at a distressing scary time.

title: Pleasant experience
body: I had four appointments in Coventry and the staff were very friendly and professional at all times. Would definitely recommend.

title: Worrying
body: I have had surgery very recently at Lincoln county hospital and then admitted shortly back after discharge to be then pushed from one ward to another! I have never been so upset and worried in my life about the lack of communication and compassion between staff and patients. It was frightening! I hope that i will never have to use this hospital again!

title: Terrible patient service
body: I had been trying for several days to get to speak/see a GP. No appointments available in the next 14 days. I went online to NHS 111 and followed the online process of logging my symptoms. I had a call back to me within 30 and was then referred to see an out of hours doctor. All done within 24 hours. Why can’t Dishley Grange medical practice offer a similar online service. They obviously don’t have enough staff to answer the phones! The service is frustrating and most people give up trying…. Other practices manage why can’t Dishley??

title: great practice
body: i attented a routine test and mentioned a lump on my head straight away a doctor organised a biopsy to be taken from then on all services were put into practice resulting being diagnosed with a rare form of cancer brook medical and their staff were excellent in the approach and information given well done all

title: Brilliant care
body: When my mother was taken into intensive care due to a severe case of sepsis through an infected pressure sore, the nurses and doctors on the intensive care ward were really kind, helpful, and attentive to the situation! They kept me updated through the phone and helped my mum through an ongoing miracle recovery which i cannot be more thankful for!

title: Melanoma excision + skin graft
body: Wonderful, caring, efficient ,professional care from all the staff. The busy receptionist could not have been more helpful (I am 80% deaf) through to the surgeon and anaesthetist who were so patient and thorough . Nurses all so caring.

title: Poor service of receptionists and Management
body: We have been informed to go to a different surgery for our appointment and the appointment is booked there due to unavailability. We have been massaged the location from the Gp number and on arrival, we found that it was not the case  and we had to go to our surgery. This made us miss the appointment. The receptionists were rude in this case and generally always are.Finally they tried to blame us for the mistake and denied sending the address bit we have proof

title: very grateful for all this practice has done for…
body:
very grateful for all this practice has done for myself and my family over the past 20 years
i feel very fortunate to have such a fantastic GP practice
many thanks

title: Fantastic staff, extremely helpful
body: I contacted the practice after multiple attemps during over a week to contact midwifery services, the staff at the practice were extremely helpful and managed to sort out my problem the same day. Always caring and considerate approach even if this issue wasn't their responsibility. Cannot thank them enough. As always 5 stars!

title: Great standard of care
body: I came into A&E with stomach pain, was seen within a few hours and transferred to the CDU while waiting for results. I then spent the next few days on Ward 2 recieving treatment. Every member of staff was friendly, helpful, and caring. I really couldn't rate everyone I came across higher, they've been amazing!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Supportive practice
body: I have been with Elm Surgery for many years. Over this time I have always felt very reassured by the care I have received. The last 18 months have been no different. The phones have been answered and the receptionists have always been most polite and helpful. I have been able to speak with a doctor and have a face to face appointment when necessary. During my appointments I have always felt listened to and treated with care and the utmost respect. All the nurses and Health care assistants have been caring, patient and understanding. You work as a wonderful team and deserve high praise for the service you offer to our community. Thank you for all you do to look after your patients

title: Excellent caring practice
body: Yet again the staff at Leeds Road have exceeded our expectations. In the past year, they have sorted out my physical and mental health problems, and those of my children, with exceptional skill and expertise, providing compassionate support in person and on the phone. Today my mother received an appointment for the hospital, having been referred yesterday following an e-consult for a possible recurrence of cancer. The GPs at Leeds Road consistently deliver beyond our expectations and we are hugely grateful for what they do for us. We cannot thank you enough.

title: Kind caring practice
body:
After using econsult we were invited to bring my very elderly mum to see a GP. The receptionist was welcoming and friendly. The GP took his time, was gentle and caring with my mum. He made sure she was comfortable and that she took part in discussions and was able to make her own decision on a care choice. Mum wasn’t asked to wear a mask which helped her feel comfortable. I feel this practice does much to enable patients to get appropriate, timely care by using as many avenues to access care possible. 
Econsult and Pushdoctor great additions.

title: Amazing Practice
body:
I visited the Surgery to get my Hepatitis B vaccines, I was greeted by a very polite receptionist, behind the clear screen you can tell they were all hardworking individuals, coping well with the very busy reception area! They definitely do not get enough credit! My nurses were absolutely brilliant, they calmed my nerves and anxiety  ( massive fear of needles) and made the whole process very quick and easy for me. Highly reccomend this practice to anyone around tooting looking for a new GP 

Thank you all for you hard work during these challenging times

title: Great care and treatment at the Street -Westfield
body: Had my second jab at the Street Westfield vaccination by the Lovely Anisa. She was very kind and caring towards my personal needs of having a female vaccinator. The staff were very helpful and attentive from the moment I walked in and to the moment I left. Great organisation and I didn’t need to wait long, they knew what they were doing and were constantly making sure I was okay!

title: Helpful information and action
body: Helpful receptionist and after explaining my problems she arranged for someone to follow up in a hour which they did arranging further treatment

title: Great Practice
body: The whole team are working so hard to provide excellent care during the pandemic .Thank you all so much for your hard work and dedication.

title: Excellent service!
body: I sent in the online form, and was contacted by telephone with 2 hours. After careful questioning about my symptoms, the doctor then saw me face to face 30 minutes later, and has prescribed the remedies that I needed. I couldn't have asked for better treatment. Thank you!

title: Good as others
body: Fortunately, to date, not needed anything serious.  Routine treatment/investigations done on a timely basis. Nothing to complain about.

title: Bucks HCT on-stop Breast Clinic
body:
I found a lump in my breast on 27/08/21 the day before a Bank Holiday weekend. I Phoned my GP that morning.
I saw my GP an hour later that morning who referred me to Wycombe Breast Clinic for an appointment. I was given an appointment on 02/09/21.
Every single aspect of this clinic worked smoothly:
Mammogram & Ultra-sound run by Radiologists who talked me through everything. Then I was seen by the Clinic Sister & finally by the Consultant & @ each stage I was examined & everything was explained to me fully. I was signed off after approx. 3/hours & told that if I ever found another lump I must always do exactly as I had done this time & never to think that I didn't want to bother the Breast Clinic again.
I am a qualified NHS nurse to Sister level & this experience was the NHS at it's very best with everything running smoothly, professionals working together in co-ordination & keeping their colleagues & their patient informed at every step of the procedure.
I had faster & better treatment by the NHS than I would have had if I had gone privately for this treatment.
Well done NHS Bucks healthcare trust & thank you, Jill R.G.N.

title: A thank you
body: I attended the hospital, croft wing, on the 24 August for an angiogram. I was nervous but the nurses put me at ease and explained everything to me. The procedure was carried out efficiently and I was kept informed throughout. I would like to thank all the people involved for their kindness.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Poor communication with families
body: My father has been in and out of Southmead several times over toast few months, various wards. I can't fault his actual care but I do have massive problems with the lack of communication with families. There is only me to help my father, and I live 3 hours away, as I explain every time. He won't use mobile phone, so I am reliant on phoning the ward, or them phoning me. Every ward is the same - they don't pick up the phone. I can call 100 times a day and not get through. Eventually I get a message that they are sending him home, so I come racing back to Bristol, but he doesn't come home, and I spend all evening calling, no answer, etc. Just tell families what is going on, please. I don't care if it's a call or an email or a text or what, just don't leave us in the dark for days and expect us to be available to pick up the pieces at moment's notice.

title: Superb service and care
body: A superb set up, where Covid secure measures were paramount at all times, and where the service and care provided during and around my op were exceptional.

title: A&E
body:
I visited A&E on Bank Holiday Sunday with a broken wrist. On my original visit I was seen quickly and the staff were great from booking in, to the radiologist to the nursing team. I was told my the doctor that I would need ‘emergency surgery’ over the following couple of days and to go home and wait for a call.
No one contacted me this week. I have been at home in so much pain and had to phone the different departments myself to try to find out what was happening. I eventually was told I had an appointment at the fracture clinic on Friday but my operation would not be until next week at the earliest!
I couldn’t stand the pain any longer so returned to A&E on Tuesday. When I checked in I was told ‘they will repot it and sort your pain relief so you’ll be in and out in half an hour’. 5 hours later I was still sat waiting in excruciating pain. I saw a nurse and a GP. I asked both to help me with my sling , neither did. The GP said he would go grab my prescription, 1.5 hours later I was still sat, in tears at this point, waiting for some pain relief. My husband came in and went to ring someone, he approached a member of staff who was on Facebook messenger walking through the department. 
I understand A&E was busy on this visit but I feel basic care needs were not met. All I needed was some pain relief.
Following this I visited the fracture clinic and the staff there were amazing. I am still at home in excruciating pain waiting for a date for my op.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Through my GP I went into Barlborough to have a hip replacement I asked my GP   to go there because of other feedback from friends, after the first 2 appointments which were general' checks and covid,I then received a call asking me to arrive on the date given to me at 6,30am,on arrival I was met at the door and made at ease as my husband could only leave me atthe main entrance because of covid. The opperation went smoothly, and I was back home at 6,45 the same day, all the staff was brilliant so nice helpful and kind, the best hospital I have ever been in or even visited, could not praise them enough, THANKS VERY MUCH, Mrs. Trudy Massey.

title: Communication soo poor!
body:
So turned away today despite having a visit booked! No prior warning or real explanation!

Called and asked to speak to someone in charge but told it a weekend and no one senior on duty?

The ward never answers! 

Absolutely awful!

title: Worst ever GP
body: This GP practice should be closed! Worst ever, no appointments given, referrals sent later than expected, never answer thier calls. Receptionist think that they can advice the patient over the phone about medication

title: A&E mask wearing optional
body: Attended on referral from a GP. Patients walking around unchallenged without masks on. Nursing staff standing around making general chat behind triage rooms and not listening during consultation, just felt in the way.  Waste of time, would advise you to go somewhere else if you're unwell.

title: Worst Service Ever
body: I suffer from anxiety and depression and have had SO much trouble trying to obtain a repeat prescription for my anti depressants. Its now been almost two weeks that I have been without medication. The surgery refuses to accept requests over the phone and has led me to the Patient Access repeat prescription online service which doesn't have a working link to actually request repeat medication. I understand from reading the help section in Patient Access that this is likely due to the surgery not making the function accessible to me. My anxiety and depression are through the roof as the system is impossible to navigate. I am at a dead end and suffering severe mental anguish as a result. I have had no help and am still suffering with no where to turn.

title: Virgin couldn't care less
body: I was referred by GP 5 months ago. He didn't tell me who I was referred to which seems to be the norm and I assumed it was the NHS. I heard nothing further until today when I received a letter from Virgin Care? informing me that I will be discharged from their "care" waiting list if I don't get in touch inside 2 wks of the letter date. Luckily due to Covid I'm not on a holiday so I have a chance. As a first Virgin communication it shows the "care" they are taking.  This is a dreadful service. Does anyone at Virgin "care"?

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: It is downright impossible to get an appointment. You can ring off the hook or be told there are no appointments and to try again tomorrow. This has gone on for months. My doctors at my Long Covid Clinic have been in contact with the practice asking them repeatedly to see me and so I can get the medication they have prescribed - I then got a txt from my GP asking me to make an appointment, so I rang up and guess what, I can't! Utterly hopeless. I can't comment on the quality of care because I haven't had any.

title: Terrible appointment system
body: I waited for almost 2 hours to get a call back to make an appointment with a GP only to be told 'no appointments left, try again next week'. No guarantee I'll get an appointment then either. Surely appointments should not be based on what is basically a lottery system - whether I'm far enough up the queue, I'd have thought it should be based on my health are needs. Also I have work so I can't really be sat around near my phone for likely an hour or more hoping to get an appointment. No wonder A&E Departments are overwhelmed, it seems as though they're the only places to get medical attention in England in the 21st Century!

title: Great clinical staff, not so great administration
body: 0/10 for the Whipps Cross estate management team and the missing receptionists on my first visit at 8 am 3 days ago - the ancient hospital sprawls out like a village with many corners unsigned, a few map signboards. Most of the reception desks were unmanned, with no telephones for unreceived visitors to telephone any centralised switchboard receptionist.  Luckily the clinical staff were as good as the administration staff bad - I'll leave a separate review for those.

title: Long waiting
body:
Been referred by 111 and booked at 11:00 o’clock ,27th week pregnant with high heart bit and high blood pressure which doctor urgently referred us to hospital ,feeling panic of my situation and positive Covid with breathless symptoms 
But they don’t care at all ,just shake their head and their shoulder 
Very disappointed

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Unable to leave a message to the doctors
body: Impossible to phone them by phone, if do get through, they put you on hold for over hour and cut you off. No other way to contact them other than phone.

title: Day surgery
body:
Wow!! The whole team were amazing.
Never felt so well looked after, every member of staff was fantastic. The surgery went so smoothly. You are all a credit to the NHS.
If I everything need to have more day surgery I will be requesting that I come back here.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care
body: All staff were very professional, kind and caring, nothing was too much trouble.  Very good communication  from all staff, I felt involved in my care and I was kept informed of all aspects of my care.

title: Excellent care and service
body: I underwent a spinal nerve root block as a day case patient and my visit and treatment were second to none throughout. All staff were friendly, helpful, caring and professional. Everything I should expect on the day was fully explained and I felt totally looked after at all times. The ambulatory care team who looked after me made me feel at ease straight away and eased my nervousness. The staff in theatre, including the porter who took me there, were great. The surgeon and the nurse (who helped me immensely by chatting with me and offering support) were fantastic as was the radiographer and the nurse who clearly explained everything to me in a warm and caring manner. This was a very positive experience and these people are a credit to the NHS.

title: Wonderful practice
body: Staff very welcoming and friendly. They all seem to care about patients. Their appointment time was very precise and enough information was provided

title: Poor service.
body: I am a diabetic with high BP and haven't seen a GP in the last 18 months except for a brief telephone appointment. I have been trying to log on to Systmonline and despite complaining to the practice and receiving new passwords I am still unable to logon. This is very frustrating and contacting the staff on phone is a nightmare.

title: Stupidly long wait
body: Waited about 8 hours with atoddler who was in extreme pain, actually screaming in pain. However other people would arrive after us and be seen and leave before us. Not acceptable even in any staffing situation

title: Disgusting
body:
I visited the Zinnia Centre for their day services. I was under the impression that it was a service to help vulnerable adults and persons with mental health issues, but must have been mistaken.
After I spoke to the reception staff I was directed towards a seat. Before I had a chance to sit down, a security guard searched my person and bag. This person didn’t introduce himself. They barely spoke to me, merely grunting and mumbling incoherently. At first I didn’t even understand they were a security guard. I tried to ask them what they wanted from me, but apparently the authority and entitlement of their position protects them from treating their fellow human beings with anything close to decency, so they just looked at me with disdain. They picked through my bag as if it was filled with something unpleasant. When they wanded me, they didn’t even direct me to lift my arms etc… they just expected me to understand. I expect this security guard relishes the opportunity to retaliate against anyone who presents as a troublemaker, so deliberately behaves this way to incite trouble.
All this security guard needed to do was introduce himself and say “I need to do a security check for the wellbeing of the staff and other visitors.” I suggest they be directed towards a new line of work as a bailiff or a prison officer. I certainly walked away from the Zinnia Centre feeling like a criminal or violent offender.

readBy.name: Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Putting lives at risk
body: Whilst restricting services at the height of the pandemic, there is no excuse for continuing this approach. Unable to book online, next to impossible to actually see a doctor - such an approach is putting lives at risk. This practice is letting its patients down and failing to provide an acceptible service. Completely unacceptible.

title: Good Practice
body: I have found the receptionist PM shifts very helpful, pleasant and efficient with mine and other’s problems I witnessed while being in the surgery. Always smiling and making others feel confident in them

title: Great service
body: I made a self referral to Outlook South West after speaking to my GP about my depression and anxiety.  She thought they would be able to help me, and they did.  They contacted me within 2 weeks of my self referral and the sessions began (by phone due to Covid restrictions).   I can honestly say that I feel so much better for the help and guidance they provided.  The homework wasn't easy, it's not something you want to do when suffering with depression, but I wanted help to get through this and find coping strategies if/when it happens again.  Although we only had 6 sessions, there was a lot of work to do and I feel, now that it is over, that I have been guided in the right direction and will be able to help myself when another bout hits.  If not, I know I can go back to them for support.  Great service.

title: Thorough and kind
body:
I was so happy with my time at this hospital. I was short of breath and had been sick for 3 weeks - they were very sympathetic and put me through loads of tests within the space of a few short hours! It was quick and I was not expecting such a thorough examination - I felt so relieved when they were able to tell me what was wrong, especially as I was worried they might be dismissive of my relatively minor ailment.

All the doctors and nurses who saw me were kind and attentive, and listened to my symptoms carefully.

Thank you so much for sorting me out!

title: Kind, informative and efficient
body: I had a cataract procedure in July, the staff were kind and helpful, put me at ease, and explained everything.  Looking forward to getting the other eye done.

title: Great Hospital
body: This last year more than ever the public have learnt to appreciate the NHS. In God’s own county of Yorkshire we are fortunate to have Airedale Hospital as a beacon of love and hope in the darkest times. It is a tribute to the management and staff that everything appears to go so well in such a large organisation and work force. The documentation about the operation was excellent and useful. The buildings are kept beautifully clean and all the staff from the humblest cleaner had a cherry smile for everyone. The food was excellent and they could even read minds and bring a cup of tea and biscuit at the right moment. All the nurses on Ward 18 went way and beyond expectations. No one ever seems to have an off day. I was in for a new knee and I took it for granted that the surgeon, was a man at the peak of his profession to hold the job at Airedale. What I discovered was the extras that came with his abilities. I was treated as an individual. He spent time talking to me to allay all my fears. He was obviously a great team motivator, he conveyed a calm air, everyone knew their job and worked together. His anesthetist I single out for particular praise, he really looked after me by my side every minute during the operation. The surgeon said to me when I was on the operating table that the only surprise I would get was when I was told the job was finished. He was right, absolutely no pain. Thanks.

title: Useless Practice
body: Get text message my blood pressure needs doing and could i submit them.  Managed to get a machine suitable for my needs to do this, i followed the instruction.  Submitted them to receive a email telling me i should not  have sent them.  It's about time staff communicated with each other.  i'm dyslexic and this doesn't help me to understand what is needed to be done.

title: Rude receptionists every time
body: Every time you call it’s like your hassling the receptionists. They are rude and extremely impolite, nosy and feel like they have a right to tell you what’s important and what’s not. They act like they are drs and know everything. I would never recommend the surgery because the receptionists are so rude. The drs are lovely so it’s a shame they employ not very nice staff

title: Nuclear Medicine
body: Nuclear Medicine on the first floor of the diagnostic centre at Colchester Hospital was visited by my Father for a DAt scan. This is an appointment process that takes a few hours as a very expensive injection has to be given and take effect before the short scan of the brain. The staff were very friendly and patient helping Dad to feel relaxed and confident. Thank you to all the Nuclear Medicine team for your fantastic attention and the important work you do. A useful leaflet was enclosed with the appointment letter which is really important to read beforehand as it explains everything about the scan. The injection was painless, the scan quiet and he was comfortable during the process. We now have a proper diagnosis which took about 3 weeks to come through and Dad is now being prescribed the appropriate medication. If you are reading this because you are due for a visit to Nuclear Medicine rest assured there is nothing to be worried about. Do remember to read the leaflet as it will answer many questions. Once again many thanks to all the wonderful staff at Nuclear Medicine Colchester.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic
body:
Was admitted to gate 45 with chest infection as I have asthma, whilst there ENT treated me for my sinus and MAX FACS.
The latter diagnosed a problem with a tooth extraction I had last year and decided a procedure had to be carried tied out.
I had the scan on a Sunday and on the Monday had the 2 hour procedure.
Max facs were absolutely amazing I am extremely dental phobic, the doctor and the staff were truly amazing keeping me calm at all times.
Gate 45 staff, well what can I say, absolutely brilliant they could not do enough for all there patients going above and beyond.
A big big thank you to all.

title: Misleading access
body: NHS 111 tried to give an appointment at a place 30 miles away! Rang own Gp surgery who stated out of hours contact Katie road.  Rang number which stated no appointment necessary but you may have a 2 hour wait.  Arrived, not seeing patients without an appointment.  Rang number message still states appointment not required.  Clearly my frustration was heard through the open window as by the time I got back to the car to ring and triage the message had been altered and I was 5th in queue.  This appointment wasn’t for me but my mom who was with me at 75 years of age.  I feel really let down and upset especially given I work in the nhs myself.

title: Rude reception telephones need chucking
body:
I'm really not sure what is going on with this practice but to get through on the telephone is an utter shambles and when you finally do get through all appointments have been taken. I can see from others reviews that everyone is having the same problem and the practice manager has said that a problem has been recognised with the telephone , but for goodness sake how long does it take to sort the issue out it's been going on for months !! 
Once you finally get an appointment the care I receive is excellent . My nurse is second to none. Nothing is never too much trouble. My Doctor is great if you can see him face to face but even that is difficult these days. Why are most appointments telephone triage still ??  If the nurses are seeing all their patients face to face why are the doctors NOT ?? I would like to know the difference !!

title: Covid Testing Site Car Park 4. Great experience…
body:
I am due to have Surgery this week coming up at the Churchill Hospital. I therefore needed to have a PCR test. Having driven some 30 miles for the test it was  really nice to meet two friendly members of staff.
What lovely gentle men😀. One doing the swabs the other helping find out about who you are and if you have an appointment.  There was a steady long cue of cars which they dealt with very efficiently and it’s was a Sunday!
The gentle man that did my test was very nice, explained what he was about to do. When he had finished the swab , he even said l hope your operation goes well for you. If l need another PCR test l would drive to the testing centre again. I hope you will praise these men for doing a great job and a credit to the Churchill Hospital. Would recommend highly. Lyn

author: Lizzie21
title: They have not supported him
body:
My granddad was admitted to hospital after a fall, he had fractured his hip and required a partial replacement. The operation was successful, however he developed an infection and was taken back into the operating theatre to have the infection 'washed through', after his return to the ward things went down hill.  
I feel that the night staff at Sandwell Hospital on Newtown 3 did not take proper care of him. Refused to take my grandad's bed pans and when he wet the bed a staff member raised their voice at him, and left him there in wet urinated bedsheets and did not wipe him up after these incidents had happened. The same staff member on at least 3 occasions has not administered his medication, which is vital for his pre-existing conditions. They have not supported him when he requested help getting a drink, making a phone call, or requesting assistance for the toilet, often ignore him when he asks, saying they will attend in a minute but do not return for at least 1 hour. One staff has been rude towards him and has been excessively heavy handed when undertaking vital checks and LTF tests.  
This has made my grandad fearful of being in hospital and being left in the care of the night staff.The day staff and consultants tending to my grandad were supportive with my grandad and us his family, especially as he is now at end of life.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Jeni4
title: My day surgery experience
body: Forth valley royal hospital for day surgery. Pamela and Laurie-ann performed my surgery and they were so lovely. They chatted to me throughout which was a great distraction for me. I was nervous and I felt a bit queasy and I was offered something sweet to help. They explained everything to me and made me feel comfortable. Fantastic experience, thank you NHS.

author: footballhb43
title: Not answering the phones
body: This is the second time I have had to get in contact regarding whiston hospital. My husband was taken to a&e. he has mixed dementia and recently diagnosed cancer. after trying to get through to a&e for 4 hours I went up to find out what was going on. I was told they were waiting for a bed. 29 hours later he is still in the department and again they are not answering the phones. only for the switchboard I would not know where he was. after my last complaint the lack of communication is still ongoing. I realise the department may be busy but after trying to get through again is impossible.

author: Nan Reetam
title: Paediatric Heart Services
body:
In September 2020 I was told by my heart consultant at the Royal Children’s Hospital that it was now time to surgically repair my 4 year old daughters VSD via keyhole surgery. While this was not urgent, the doctor felt that a spurt was damaging her heart valve. This surgery would be via keyhole surgery in Dublin and the appointment and information given all went well.  
In May 2021 I was contacted via Belfast to ask me to bring my daughter to Dublin in 7 days time. After organising emergency leave from my job as a teacher and alternative childcare arrangements for my other 2 daughters to allow my husband to come, we were informed on Thursday that the surgery on the following Tuesday was cancelled. The reason for this was given as the Cyber attack on the Irish healthcare system. At the time I understood these exceptional circumstances and I was assured my daughter was top of the list and would be contacted soon. We then ensured that required faecal samples were up to date.  
In July 2021, the day before my mother passed away from cancer, I received a phone call this time directly from Dublin asking me to bring my daughter in. Given the circumstances it was agreed that she would be put on the surgery list for a week later with the proviso that this could be cancelled due to an emergency. What followed from here was, and still is, a catalogue of poor communication between Dublin, Belfast and myself.  
I had to contact Emma in Belfast directly who was very helpful and organised COVID tests and a hotel room. they sent out a useful information pack, although it was clearly written for pre COVID operations and I was disappointed that it wasn’t clear what changes COVID would make.  
Heartbeat Trust were also helpful in giving advice about car parks and available resources in Crumlin Children’s Hospital.  
A few days before the operation, I contacted Dublin early the morning to be told that my daughter’s surgery was cancelled due to emergencies and a limited surgery list. It was unclear at what time I might have been informed of this. I contacted Belfast to inform Emma to cancel the hotel, my husband Knockbracken to cancel our COVID tests and then I cancelled my childcare arrangements. Finally I had to inform my 5 year old that, for the second time, the doctor couldn’t fix her heart this week. In the meantime she was put down for another date in the coming weeks.  
At 2:00pm a few days before the new operation date, I confirmed the hotel and COVID tests with Emma and then received a phone from Dublin saying that, due to a limited surgery list and emergencies, My daughter’s operation was cancelled. I rang Belfast, COVID test centre, childcare and then told my daughter for the third time that her heart couldn’t be fixed. She was put on the surgery list for a week later.  
During the week I heard nothing from anyone regarding surgery. On Friday I telephoned Dublin for information but there was no answer despite several calls. The previous week we had been told the surgery would proceed and we would be telephoned the day before the operation with details of admission. We proceeded with our COVID tests, packed our bags, prepped our daughters for staying away and My daughter for her operation. I telephoned Dublin at 10:30am, just to be sure, where I was informed that the reason no one had taken my call due to holidays.  
Of course, this is expected at this time of year but I’m so disappointed that no one else took over our case during this time , contacted us or answered our calls. We were then informed that the operation was cancelled again. This time it was because the surgeon was absent this week so the operation could not happen. I then had to ring Emma to cancel the hotel and tell my daughter for the 4th time that we couldn’t get her heart fixed.  
I am so disappointed at the reason for this cancellation as I cannot understand how we were put on a surgery list of a surgeon who wouldn't be there. Nor do I understand why no one contacted us at any point to tell us this. I wonder when Dublin would have contacted me had I not telephoned. I was told I would be contacted regarding confirmation of surgery for next month following a meeting but I received no phone call. While on the phone to Emma I reiterated that this situation is very difficult for us as a family and she was understanding. As a teacher my holiday period will end on 12/8 and my daughter is due to start school on 27/8. My husband’s work have been told he will be on holiday 3 times and have been flexible in allowing this to cancelled but their tolerance is naturally waning.  
In the meantime I feel that I cannot risk taking my family to any crowded areas in case anyone gets COVID which would result in cancellation. We have not celebrated 2 birthdays due to bereavement and the ongoing surgery issues and have not taken any time away this summer. I am a tolerant person and understand well the pressures our healthcare is under. I realise that emergencies can happen and there is always a risk of cancellation. However, this escapade of 4 cancellations, particularly this last one, and lack of communication has left me at the end of my tether. I can’t risk cancelling but the cycle of this system we are in at the minute is quite unbelievable.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Very patient
body: Had a mri today and I’m extremely claustrophobic. The nurse was great with me and I’m pleased to say I managed to have it done.Thank you so much

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Excellent practice,
body:
A complete change for the better at the Mandeville Practice.
Care courtesy and compassion was shown by all members of staff. Time was allowed to listen to my problems and action was promptly taken.A completely professional and caring practice. Well done to all concern.

.

title: Good service
body:
Great service by the surgery nursing team. Full check up with COVID vaccine given after issues booking via the NHS.
Helpful and friendly service

title: Would not recommend
body:
I would not recommend using The Wall House Surgery.

I have had numerous issues with The Wall House Surgery over the last two years.

When I called to talk to the Practice Manager I was shouted at on the phone by a member of the Admin team, the practice manager did not correctly review my complaints. 

I have been waiting months for replies to emails regarding key care issues.

I have been told by Wallhouse they would call back to arrange an appointment, this did not happen.

When I called to discuss suicidal thoughts I was not taken seriously or offered support by the practice. 

The GP originally offered to act as an advocate with regards to a local trust, this was then withdrawn and denied ever being offered by the staff.

title: Great staff and well managed
body:
The practice has been extremely helpful to me and my family and we cannot thank them enough. Always warm and welcoming and the staff on the front desk are very helpful
Thank you Marylebone Health Centre for everything you do!

title: Phone consultation 1 hour and 10 mins late
body: I had a phone appointment booked today for 4.30pm. It got to 5pm and still nobody had called me, so I called the practice to find out if my appointment was still going ahead. Eventually the GP did call me but it was at 5.40pm, an hour and 10 minutes late. I can understand them running a little late, especially at the end of the day, but more than an hour is not really on, especially as there was no communication about the delay either. Luckily I did not have any plans after my appointment today, but had the appointment been booked earlier on in the day, perhaps during my lunch break at work for example, then I simply would not have been able to attend if it was over an hour late and would have had no choice but to miss it and re-book. As a working person with a busy life I cannot simply sit around waiting like this. Had it been the other way around, with me being over an hour late to my appointment, it most likely would have been cancelled and marked as DNA.

title: Impersonal
body:
The GPs I've spoken to have been courteous and professional, the difficulty is really in not being able to speak to the same GP throughout any illness or course of treatment. Very few of the doctors work more than 2 days per week, Registrars and newly qualified GPs are only with the surgery for short periods and there is a high turnover of locums. 

On a practical level, the greater part of any appointment with a different GP is spent going through the history which often leaves very little time to deal with the issue itself. This makes the management of the feel very disjointed and inconsistent - particularly when one GP takes a different approach to any of the previous ones. 

And on a personal level, it means there is no opportunity to build up a relationship and each new appointment feels very perfunctory. It's more like attending a large hospital than a local community practice.

[NB. I don't mind the shift towards remote appointments and use of the App and texts. I don't think that, in itself, impersonalises the service. Most of the feedback on this has been negative, but for a lot of people it saves having to take time off work getting to and from the surgery]

title: No Communication
body:
Was recommended to arrive @A&E by Vision Express by 2PM then they would forward my son to the Minors to be assessed by a opthalmology specialist. We were made to wait 3 hours in an A&E environment during a rise in Covid infections. I even mentioned at the triage booking in reception that we were instructed to go to Minors by Vision Express representative but they were giving there own prognosis.

Finally on the 3rd Hour we were told to go to outpatients to meet the GP. She was absolutely brilliant and gave an excellent professional service. After the assessment she contacted the specialist and he mentioned that we were supposed to be @Minors by 2pm. I did mention that we told to wait in A&E. Unfortunately as he was on call he had already left and would have to revisit the next day... awaiting his call.

Hopefully, it all goes well this time. As I also work in a NHS Trust and understand the pressures that come with the roles I do try to comprehend. However, I did try and explain the situation but they wouldn't listen. I would say the distinct lack of communication in the system is apparent.

WECARE....?

title: Lumbar surgery
body: All staff from every level and every department were very professional, efficient,friendly and caring. Highly recommend.
